data.title: Famous Birthdays on October 10
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays for the 10th of October. See which celebrities, historical figures, scientists and criminals were born on October 10.
data.text:
Birthdays 1 - 200 of 270

Mary Plantagenet, English princess, daughter of Edward III of England and Philippa of Hainault, born in Waltham, Hampshire (d. 1362)

Selim I 'the Grim' Sultan of Turkey (1512-1520), conquered Mamluk Sultanate of Egypt, born in Amasya, Ottoman Empire (d. 1520)

Charles III, Duke of Savoy (1504-53), born in Chazey-sur-Ain, France (d. 1553)

Infanta Catherine Michelle of Spain [Catalina Micaela de Austria], Duchess consort of Savoy (1585-97), born in Madrid, Spain (d. 1597)

Jacob Aertsz Colom, Dutch publisher (Consolation of the Sea), born in Dordrecht, Netherlands (d. 1673)

John Campbell, 2nd duke of Argyll and field marshal (Union of 1707), born in Ham House, Petersham, Surrey (d. 1743)

Jean-Antoine Watteau, French Rococo painter (fêtes galantes), born in Valenciennes, France (d. 1721)

Lambert-Sigisbert Adam, French sculptor, born in Nancy, Kingdom of France (d. 1759)

Johann Ludwig Krebs, German organist and composer, born in Buttelstedt, Germany (d. 1780)

Henry Cavendish, England, physicist and chemist (discovered hydrogen), born in Nice (d. 1810)

Benjamin West, Anglo-American painter (Death of General Wolfe), born in Springfield, Province of Pennsylvania (d. 1820)

Erik Acharius, Swedish botanist (lichens), born in Gävle, Sweden (d. 1819)

Antoine Philippe Vischer, comte de Celles, Belgian-French politician, born in Brussels (d. 1841)

Albin Masek, Czech composer, born in Prague, Kingdom of Bohemia (now Czech Republic) (d. 1878)

Giuseppe Verdi

Italian opera composer (Rigoletto, La Traviata), born in Busseto

Zebulon York, American Brigadier General (Confederate Army), born in Avon, Maine (d. 1900)

Paul Kruger

3rd President of South African Republic (1883-1900) and face of Boer resistance during the Second Boer War, born in Steynsburg, Cape Colony

Dandridge McRae, American Brigadier General (Confederate Army), born in Baldwin County, Alabama (d. 1899)
